options.title: -a
options.description: Mark variables which are modified or created for export.

options.title: -b
options.description: Notify of job termination immediately.

options.title: -e
options.description: Exit immediately if a command exits with a non-zero status.

options.title: -f
options.description: Disable file name generation (globbing).

options.title: -h
options.description: Remember the location of commands as they are looked up.

options.title: -k
options.description: All assignment arguments are placed in the environment for a command, not just those that precede the command name.

options.title: -m
options.description: Job control is enabled.

options.title: -n
options.description: Read commands but do not execute them.

options.title: -o option-name
options.description: Set the variable corresponding to option-name: allexport same as -a braceexpand same as -B emacs use an emacs-style line editing interface errexit same as -e errtrace same as -E functrace same as -T hashall same as -h histexpand same as -H history enable command history ignoreeof the shell will not exit upon reading EOF interactive-comments allow comments to appear in interactive commands keyword same as -k monitor same as -m noclobber same as -C noexec same as -n noglob same as -f nolog currently accepted but ignored notify same as -b nounset same as -u onecmd same as -t physical same as -P pipefail the return value of a pipeline is the status of the last command to exit with a non-zero status, or zero if no command exited with a non-zero status posix change the behavior of bash where the default operation differs from the Posix standard to match the standard privileged same as -p verbose same as -v vi use a vi-style line editing interface xtrace same as -x

options.title: -p
options.description: Turned on whenever the real and effective user ids do not match. Disables processing of the $ENV file and importing of shell functions. Turning this option off causes the effective uid and gid to be set to the real uid and gid.

options.title: -t
options.description: Exit after reading and executing one command.

options.title: -u
options.description: Treat unset variables as an error when substituting.

options.title: -v
options.description: Print shell input lines as they are read.

options.title: -x
options.description: Print commands and their arguments as they are executed.

options.title: -B
options.description: the shell will perform brace expansion

options.title: -C
options.description: If set, disallow existing regular files to be overwritten by redirection of output.

options.title: -E
options.description: If set, the ERR trap is inherited by shell functions.

options.title: -H
options.description: Enable ! style history substitution. This flag is on by default when the shell is interactive.

options.title: -P
options.description: If set, do not resolve symbolic links when executing commands such as cd which change the current directory.

options.title: -T
options.description: If set, the DEBUG and RETURN traps are inherited by shell functions.
